Some US senators claimed the plan reflected a Russian "wish list," which the US denied.
President Trump stated his plan is not the final offer for resolving the conflict.
The proposal was presented to President Zelenskyy on Thursday for consideration.

clusters.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro arrested over flight risk after tampering with his ankle monitor
clusters.neutral_headline: Bolsonaro Arrested in Brazil Over Flight Risk

items.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro arrested over flight risk after tampering with his ankle monitor
items.standfirst: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal custody on Saturday over suspicion he would try to evade his 27-year prison sentence. The arrest, ordered by the Supreme Court, came after Bolsonaro allegedly tampered with his ankle monitor, prompting fears he might flee amid demonstrations organised by his family.
items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal custody on Saturday over suspicion he would try to evade his 27-year prison sentence. The arrest, ordered by the Supreme Court, came after Bolsonaro allegedly tampered with his ankle monitor, prompting fears he might flee amid demonstrations organised by his family.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after being deemed a flight risk
items.standfirst: The former Brazilian president is suspected of damaging an ankle bracelet as part of an alleged escape plan.
items.content: The former Brazilian president is suspected of damaging an ankle bracelet as part of an alleged escape plan.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after tampering with ankle tag ‘out of curiosity’
items.standfirst: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...

items.title: Brazilian court orders preemptive arrest of former president Jair Bolsonaro
items.standfirst: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into custody after being deemed a “concrete flight risk” while under house arrest. The former Brazilian president was convicted in September of plotting a military coup and sentenced to more than 27 years in prison, though he has remained under house arrest while his appeals proceed. Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes said the decision to detain the 70-year-old was a preventive measure prompted by “new facts” that had recently emerged. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.
items.content: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into custody after being deemed a “concrete flight risk” while under house arrest. The former Brazilian president was convicted in September of plotting a military coup and sentenced to more than 27 years in prison, though he has remained under house arrest while his appeals proceed. Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes said the decision to detain the 70-year-old was a preventive measure prompted by “new facts” that had recently emerged. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.

items.title: Former president Jair Bolsonaro arrested due to "flight risk"
items.standfirst: Federal police detained Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday after a Supreme Court judge deemed the far-right firebrand a "high flight risk". The arrest comes just days before Bolsonaro is due to begin a 27-year prison term for leading a botched coup attempt. Caroline Baum reports.
items.content: Federal police detained Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday after a Supreme Court judge deemed the far-right firebrand a "high flight risk". The arrest comes just days before Bolsonaro is due to begin a 27-year prison term for leading a botched coup attempt. Caroline Baum reports.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro arrested for allegedly plotting escape ahead of prison term
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.(Image credit: Luis Nova)

items.title: Ex-Brazil president 'tried to open ankle monitor' with soldering iron in 'escape attempt'
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been arrested after allegedly trying to open his ankle monitor with a soldering iron in a bid to flee and avoid a jail term, according to court documents.
items.content: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been arrested after allegedly trying to open his ankle monitor with a soldering iron in a bid to flee and avoid a jail term, according to court documents.

ai_summary: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was arrested on suspicion of flight risk.
He allegedly tampered with his ankle monitor, raising concerns about his intentions.
Bolsonaro was sentenced to 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup.
The arrest was ordered by the Supreme Court as a preventive measure.
Bolsonaro claimed he damaged the ankle monitor out of curiosity.

items.content: Days of torrential rain leaves vast swathes of the country inundated and facing landslides.

items.title: Vietnam floods kill at least 90
items.standfirst: Severe flooding and landslides caused by heavy rains killed at least 90 people in Vietnam, authorities said on Sunday. Natural disasters between January and October already left 279 people dead or missing in the country and caused more than $2 billion in damage
items.content: Severe flooding and landslides caused by heavy rains killed at least 90 people in Vietnam, authorities said on Sunday. Natural disasters between January and October already left 279 people dead or missing in the country and caused more than $2 billion in damage

items.title: Vietnam flooding death toll reaches 90 amid landslides and relentless rain
items.standfirst: Environment ministry says most of the deaths were in the mountainous central province of Dak LakThe death toll from major flooding in Vietnam has risen to 90, with 12 more people missing, the environment ministry said on Sunday after days of heavy rain and landslides.Relentless rain has lashed south-central Vietnam since late October and popular holiday destinations have been hit by several rounds of flooding. Continue reading...
items.content: Environment ministry says most of the deaths were in the mountainous central province of Dak LakThe death toll from major flooding in Vietnam has risen to 90, with 12 more people missing, the environment ministry said on Sunday after days of heavy rain and landslides.Relentless rain has lashed south-central Vietnam since late October and popular holiday destinations have been hit by several rounds of flooding. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The death toll from floods in Vietnam has climbed to at least 90.
Heavy rains and landslides have caused widespread devastation in the country.
Twelve people are still missing after the severe weather events.
The majority of deaths occurred in the central province of Dak Lak.
Natural disasters have caused over $2 billion in damage this year.

items.title: Israel launches strikes in Gaza ceasefire's latest test as hospitals say 24 killed
Gaza ceasefire under strain: Israeli military launches airstrikes against Hamas militants
items.standfirst: Israel launched on Saturday airstrikes on Gaza which killed at least 24 people and wounded dozens in the latest test of the fragile October 10 ceasefire. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said the strikes targeted and killed five senior Hamas members. France24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky reports the latest from Jerusalem.
items.content: Israel launched on Saturday airstrikes on Gaza which killed at least 24 people and wounded dozens in the latest test of the fragile October 10 ceasefire. Aid flows to Gaza remain heavily restricted due to the ongoing conflict.

items.content: Tatiana Schlossberg, 35, says she was diagnosed shortly after giving birth in 2024 and has less than a year to live.

items.title: JFK's granddaughter reveals terminal cancer diagnosis - as she hits out at relative RFK Jr

items.content: John F Kennedy's granddaughter has revealed she has terminal cancer, making the announcement on the anniversary of the ex-US president's assassination.

items.title: JFK's granddaughter reveals terminal cancer diagnosis, criticizes cousin RFK Jr
Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK, announces terminal cancer diagnosis
items.standfirst: Journalist, daughter of Caroline Kennedy and Edwin Schlossberg, reveals she has acute myeloid leukemiaTatiana Schlossberg, a journalist and the granddaughter of John F Kennedy, disclosed on Saturday that she has been diagnosed with terminal cancer, saying her doctor informed her that she has less than a year left to live.The environmental writer also addressed her cousin, Robert F Kennedy Jr, criticizing the influence his policies as secretary of health and human services have had on her experience with the illness. Continue reading...
items.content: Journalist, daughter of Caroline Kennedy and Edwin Schlossberg, reveals she has acute myeloid leukemiaTatiana Schlossberg, a journalist and the granddaughter of John F Kennedy, disclosed on Saturday that she has been diagnosed with terminal cancer, saying her doctor informed her that she has less than a year left to live.The environmental writer also addressed her cousin, Robert F Kennedy Jr, criticizing the influence his policies as secretary of health and human services have had on her experience with the illness. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Tatiana Schlossberg, JFK's granddaughter, announced a terminal cancer diagnosis.
She was diagnosed shortly after giving birth and has less than a year to live.
She criticized her cousin, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., regarding his policies.
The announcement was made on the anniversary of JFK's assassination.
Schlossberg is a journalist and the daughter of Caroline Kennedy.

clusters.title: Nigeria: At least 315 children and teachers kidnapped in second school abduction this week
clusters.neutral_headline: Nigeria School Abduction: Over 300 Kidnapped

items.title: Nigeria: At least 315 children and teachers kidnapped in second school abduction this week
items.standfirst: A Christian organisation said on Saturday, 22 November, that 315 students and teachers had been seized the previous day in Nigeria’s second mass school abduction within a week, heightening security concerns in Africa’s most populous nation. The early-morning raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger State followed an attack on Monday in neighbouring Kebbi State, where gunmen abducted 25 girls from a secondary school. Gabrielle Nadler reports.
items.content: A Christian organisation said on Saturday, 22 November, that 315 students and teachers had been seized the previous day in Nigeria’s second mass school abduction within a week, heightening security concerns in Africa’s most populous nation. The early-morning raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger State followed an attack on Monday in neighbouring Kebbi State, where gunmen abducted 25 girls from a secondary school. Gabrielle Nadler reports.

items.title: Security fears rise in Nigeria after more than 300 schoolchildren kidnapped
items.standfirst: Christian group revises up number of students and teachers missing after one of country’s largest mass abductionGunmen have kidnapped more than 300 students and teachers in one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria, a Christian group said on Saturday, as security fears mounted in Africa’s most populous nation.The early Friday raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger state in western Nigeria came after gunmen on Monday stormed a secondary school in neighbouring Kebbi state, abducting 25 girls. Continue reading...
items.content: Christian group revises up number of students and teachers missing after one of country’s largest mass abductionGunmen have kidnapped more than 300 students and teachers in one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria, a Christian group said on Saturday, as security fears mounted in Africa’s most populous nation.The early Friday raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger state in western Nigeria came after gunmen on Monday stormed a secondary school in neighbouring Kebbi state, abducting 25 girls. Continue reading...

items.title: More than 300 children were abducted in an attack on a Catholic school in Nigeria
items.standfirst: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.
items.content: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.(Image credit: Christian Association of Nigeria)

items.title: Nigeria reels after 215 children taken in second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...
items.content: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Over 300 students and teachers were kidnapped in Nigeria.
The abduction occurred at St Mary's co-educational school.
This is the second mass school abduction in Nigeria this week.
Gunmen attacked a secondary school in Kebbi State earlier in the week.
The Christian Association of Nigeria reported the abductions.

clusters.title: Bosnia’s autonomous Serb Republic votes for new president after Dodik's removal
clusters.neutral_headline: Bosnian Serbs Hold Snap Poll After Dodik Removal

items.title: Bosnia’s autonomous Serb Republic votes for new president after Dodik's removal
items.standfirst: Voters in Bosnia’s autonomous Serb Republic headed to the polls on Sunday for a snap presidential election, triggered after former president Milorad Dodik was removed from office and barred from politics for six years. The outcome will determine whether the Serb-majority region shifts away from Dodik’s nationalist agenda or continues pursuing separatist policies that threaten the internal stability of the already fragile Balkan state. Charlotte Lam explains.
items.content: Voters in Bosnia’s autonomous Serb Republic headed to the polls on Sunday for a snap presidential election, triggered after former president Milorad Dodik was removed from office and barred from politics for six years. The outcome will determine whether the Serb-majority region shifts away from Dodik’s nationalist agenda or continues pursuing separatist policies that threaten the internal stability of the already fragile Balkan state. Charlotte Lam explains.

items.title: Bosnian Serbs hold snap poll to replace banned leader
items.standfirst: Bosnian Serbs will head to the polls on Sunday to pick a replacement for their entity’s banned president, Milorad Dodik, after he was removed for defying Bosnia’s international peace envoy. items.title: Safe haven to sanctions: how Jersey sheltered Roman Abramovich’s billions
items.standfirst: Court papers show the island cautiously welcomed the oligarch – with London’s approval – before Russia’s invasion of UkraineFor decades the Channel Islands tax haven of Jersey has played a big role in moving fortunes made in some of the world’s most despotic countries into the west, attracting overseas oligarchs with a mix of low tax and high levels of financial secrecy.It is a secrecy that extends to Jersey’s relationship with the UK government. As a crown dependency, Jersey has its own parliament, but belongs to the king. The relationship between the two jurisdictions remains something of a black box, with very little public information on how the big decisions are made, or to what extent Westminster is consulted. Continue reading...
items.content: Court papers show the island cautiously welcomed the oligarch – with London’s approval – before Russia’s invasion of UkraineFor decades the Channel Islands tax haven of Jersey has played a big role in moving fortunes made in some of the world’s most despotic countries into the west, attracting overseas oligarchs with a mix of low tax and high levels of financial secrecy.It is a secrecy that extends to Jersey’s relationship with the UK government. As a crown dependency, Jersey has its own parliament, but belongs to the king. The relationship between the two jurisdictions remains something of a black box, with very little public information on how the big decisions are made, or to what extent Westminster is consulted. Continue reading...

The relationship between Jersey and the UK government is opaque.
Jersey is a Channel Islands tax haven.

items.content: While AI bubble talk fills the air these days, with fears of overinvestment that could pop at any time, something of a contradiction is brewing on the ground: Companies like Google and OpenAI can barely build infrastructure fast enough to fill their AI needs. During an all-hands meeting earlier…

items.title: Google tells employees it must double capacity every 6 months to meet AI demand
items.standfirst: Google's AI infrastructure chief tells staff it needs thousandfold capacity increase in 5 years.
items.content: While AI bubble talk fills the air these days, with fears of overinvestment that could pop at any time, something of a contradiction is brewing on the ground: Companies like Google and OpenAI can barely build infrastructure fast enough to fill their AI needs. During an all-hands meeting earlier this month, Google’s AI infrastructure head Amin Vahdat told employees that the company must double its serving capacity every six months to meet demand for artificial intelligence services, reports CNBC. The comments show a rare look at what Google executives are telling its own employees internally. Vahdat, a vice president at Google Cloud, presented slides to its employees showing the company needs to scale “the next 1000x in 4-5 years.” While a thousandfold increase in compute capacity sounds ambitious by itself, Vahdat noted some key constraints: Google needs to be able to deliver this increase in capability, compute, and storage networking “for essentially the same cost and increasingly, the same power, the same energy level,” he told employees during the meeting. “It won’t be easy but through collaboration and co-design, we’re going to get there.”Read full article Comments

ai_summary: Google needs to rapidly increase its AI infrastructure.
The company aims to double capacity every six months.
Google's AI infrastructure chief addressed employees.
The goal is to meet the growing demand for AI.
The company plans a thousandfold capacity increase in five years.

items.title: Eleven injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren and teachers in Canada
items.standfirst: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...
